FuncDef:
The ipv6 address-policy command configures the policies for selecting source and destination addresses.
The undo ipv6 address-policy command deletes the policies for selecting source and destination addresses. The ipv6 address-policy command configures the policies for selecting source and destination addresses. The undo ipv6 address-policy command deletes the policies for selecting source and destination addresses. By default, only default address selection policy entries are configured. These entries are prefixed with ::1, ::, 2002::, FC00::, and ::ffff:0.0.0.0. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Specifies the IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the prefix length of an IPv6 address.
It is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

Specifies the priority of an IPv6 address when the address is the destination address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the priority of an IPv6 address when the address is the source address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo: Source/destination addresses used for sending out can be manipulated by applying policy entries into the policy table. The ipv6 address-policy command allows the user to configure source/destination address selection policy for an address/prefix. The policy table allows the user to give preference to an address/prefix in comparison to other available addresses/prefixes during the source/destination address selection.
